result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amended OTP
Incorrect Information

8:53 AM Defendant Jamerion Antonio Lee Lott appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Lincoln Hills.  Attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski in court for Jamerion Antonio Lee Lott.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Lincoln Hills and if a Zoom appearance is being requested Attorney Ostrowski will make the arrangements with the Trial Court. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Atty Ostrowski requesting Zoom
Detainer placed at Lincoln Hills School.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Lincoln Hills School

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

3:21 PM Defendant Jamerion Antonio Lee Lott appeared by video from Lincoln Hills School, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikki Kane. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula for Atty. Ostrowski.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.  Atty. Ostrowski to notify the clerk's office a week before if the preliminary hearing is waived.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Lincoln Hills School.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
